{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3481131,"name":"Tharun","username":"thaMan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/e5b9ba/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-13T18:36:55.233Z","cooked":"

Hi guys I had a few questions in setting up Advantage Scope. So I want to setup a swerve drive model alongside the code on advantage scope and I was wondering how I would go about it. I already have working code setup alongside CAD from on-shape and I was wondering if I would need anything else before attempting to get this set up in Advantage Scope.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-01-13T18:36:55.233Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":652,"reads":234,"readers_count":233,"score":3301.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":481427,"topic_slug":"setting-up-advantage-scope-for-the-first-time","display_username":"Tharun","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57591,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/setting-up-advantage-scope-for-the-first-time/481427/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3481134,"name":"Alex","username":"ajs2","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ajs2/{size}/200927_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-13T18:40:23.430Z","cooked":"

You donâ€™t need CAD for AdvantageScope unless you want to see a 3D model of your robot in the 3D view. Check https://docs.advantagescope.org for all the details on how to set it up (or click at the top of the window, next to the list of tabs).

AdvantageScope doesnâ€™t need your code to run, only what you publish to NetworkTables. To add your robotâ€™s model to AScope, follow the instructions here:

docs.advantagescope.org

Custom Assets | AdvantageScope

AdvantageScope uses a default set of flat field images, field models, robot models, and joystick configurations. Simple assets (e.g. evergreen fields) are included in the initial installation. Detailed assets (e.g. season-specific fields) are...

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-01-13T19:33:45.735Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":140,"readers_count":139,"score":48.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":481427,"topic_slug":"setting-up-advantage-scope-for-the-first-time","display_username":"Alex","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.advantagescope.org/more-features/custom-assets/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Custom Assets | AdvantageScope","clicks":65}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56260,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6238 alum (he/they)"},"post_url":"/t/setting-up-advantage-scope-for-the-first-time/481427/7","custom_user_title":"6238 alum (he/they)","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3481263,"name":"Dan Katzuv","username":"dan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/eada6e/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-13T20:25:30.048Z","cooked":"

If you only want to see a serve drivetrain you can use one of the built in robot models. You only need to import a custom CAD model if you want to show other mechanisms (arms, intakes, etc).

So just so that I understand it Advantage Scope requires me to use Data Loggers to send data straight into the Advantage Scope GUI and if I were to upload a model of my CAD using said Loggers it would be able convert that data into robot motion.

You need to send the logged data over NetworkTables, most if not all logging solutions do that for you. Then you can import a 3D CAD file and tell AdvantageScope to move the components according to poses published to NetworkTables.
I suggest reading the AdvantageScope documentation:

docs.advantagescope.org

Getting Started | AdvantageScope

These pages cover the basics of getting around in AdvantageScope and and accessing data.
